column1: Subareolar abscess is an abscess, or growth, on the areolar gland.
This blockage leads to infection of the glands.
Symptoms of an areolar abscess are: - Swollen, tender lump beneath the areolar area - Drainage and possible pus from this lump - Fever - General ill feeling
Your health care provider will perform a breast exam.
Subareolar abscesses are treated with antibiotics and by opening and draining the infected tissue.
